body_html:
For the following ops:

crop_to_bounding_box
pad_to_bounding_box
central_crop
resize_images
resize_image_with_crop_or_pad

Because of their structure, if we want to make them like tf.name_scope suggests, we need to add tf.identity to rename the last ops (Is there another better way?). I am not sure if it is what we want.
body_text:
For the following ops:

crop_to_bounding_box
pad_to_bounding_box
central_crop
resize_images
resize_image_with_crop_or_pad

Because of their structure, if we want to make them like tf.name_scope suggests, we need to add  tf.identity to rename the last ops (Is there another better way?). I am not sure if it is what we want.
body:
For the following ops:
> crop_to_bounding_box
> pad_to_bounding_box
> central_crop
> resize_images
> resize_image_with_crop_or_pad

Because of their structure, if we want to make them like [tf.name_scope](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/name_scope) suggests, we need to add  `tf.identity` to rename the last ops (Is there another better way?). I am not sure if it is what we want.
